column4: like i said im new to linux so if someone could give alittle help as to how to get the connection to my network to work i would apreciate it
Where are you at with your networking problem..
ive got it connected but it will not alow me to browse
What type of netwrork card do you have
i dont know off the top of my head and im not by my machine
im sure its just your standard network easy ethernet card
In order to help us help you, we need to know as much as possible about your hardware, wired, wireless, cable, dsl, router, version of ubuntu..
There is no such thing
aight i have a cisco bridge going to a smc router then i have a cable coming out of the router to the machine
Sorry, not trying to be cute or curt...
Great start, we have a wired system
my other machine with ms vista are working
Is it internal on a desktop, pcmcia on a laptop, usb off a port..?
off a port on a desktop
So it is a usb network adapter...  so it should be easy to find out the make and model..
It will probably end up being a broadcom BCM43xx chipset but we still need to check
aight well like i said im not at my machine, just to clairify i have to manually set the network up, because i know they are taking to eack other the activity light is working
just have your auto config the monitor
We have great walk throughs depending on your hardware.. it is not a big deal
where are these walk through located
If you do have a BCM43xx chipset here is a useful page... http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=185174
